Name: Garlic Mushroom Stir-Fry
recipe: Heat oil in a pan and sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant. Add carrots, mushrooms, and green chilli. Stir-fry on medium heat for 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Name: Chicken & Vegetable Stew
recipe: In a pot, sauté garlic and onion until soft. Add diced potatoes and carrots. Pour water or broth and bring to a boil. Add chicken pieces and cook until tender. Adjust seasoning and serve warm.

Name: Vegetable & Egg Stir-Fry
recipe: Beat the eggs and set aside. Stir-fry garlic, onion, capsicum, and carrot until semi-soft. Add beaten eggs and scramble. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with rice or on its own.

Name: Spicy Cabbage & Potato Stir-Fry
recipe: Heat oil in a pan. Fry garlic and onion until golden. Add potatoes and cook until soft. Add cabbage and green chilli, stir well. Cook for 5 more minutes, season, and serve with flatbread or rice.

Name: Chocolate Banana Delight
recipe: Melt chocolate in a bowl. Slice bananas and dip them into the melted chocolate. Sprinkle sugar on top if desired. Chill for 10 minutes before serving.

Name: Classic Egg Curry
recipe: Boil eggs and potatoes. In a pan, sauté garlic, ginger, and onion. Add green chilli and spices. Add boiled potatoes and eggs. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve hot with rice or flatbread.

Name: Apple & Blueberry Fruit Salad
recipe: Chop apples into bite-sized pieces. Mix gently with fresh blueberries. Optionally sprinkle with sugar or a pinch of salt. Serve chilled.

Name: Carrot Halwa
recipe: Grate carrots and cook in a pan. Add sugar and stir continuously. Let it cook on low heat until soft and slightly caramelized. Serve warm or cold.

Name: Beetroot & Apple Dessert Bowl
recipe: Boil beetroot until soft, then dice it. Chop apples. Mix both in a bowl with sugar. Chill for 10 minutes and serve as a refreshing dessert.

Name: Potato & Brinjal Masala Curry
recipe: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil. Add diced potatoes and brinjal. Cook with spices and green chilli until soft. Add water to make gravy. Simmer and serve with rice or roti.

Name: Carrot Ladoo
recipe: Grate carrots and cook them in a pan with sugar on low heat. Keep stirring until moisture evaporates. Shape into small ladoos while warm. Cool and serve.

Name: Spicy Potato Bites
recipe: Boil and cube potatoes. Sauté garlic, onion, and green chilli. Toss the potatoes with the mixture until crisp. Sprinkle with salt and serve hot with chutney.

Name: Cabbage & Carrot Cutlets
recipe: Grate cabbage and carrot. Mix with onion, garlic, flour, and spices. Shape into small patties. Pan-fry until golden brown. Serve with ketchup or chutney.

Name: Brinjal Chips
recipe: Slice brinjal thinly. Dip in a flour-based batter spiced with garlic and green chilli. Deep fry until crispy. Serve as a crunchy appetizer.

Name: Mushroom & Capsicum Skewers
recipe: Thread mushrooms, capsicum, and onion onto skewers. Brush with garlic-infused oil. Grill or roast until charred. Serve with a spicy dip.

Name: Stuffed Capsicum Rings
recipe: Cut capsicum into thick rings. Prepare a mashed mixture of potato, carrot, onion, and garlic. Stuff the rings and shallow fry until golden. Serve hot with chutney.

Name: Aloo Chaat
recipe: Boil and dice potatoes. Mix with chopped onions, grated carrot, and green chilli. Toss with chaat masala and lemon juice. Serve immediately.

Name: Gobi Matar Masala
recipe: Sauté garlic, onion, and green chilli. Add chopped cabbage and cook until soft. Add spices and a little water. Simmer until done and serve with rice or roti.

Name: Egg Bhurji
recipe: Beat eggs and set aside. Sauté garlic, onion, and green chilli. Add beaten eggs and scramble until cooked. Season and serve hot with chapati.

Name: Khatta-Meetha Beetroot Tikki
recipe: Grate beetroot and mix with mashed potatoes, onions, flour, and spices. Shape into tikkis. Shallow fry until crispy. Serve with chutney.

Name: Baingan Bharta
recipe: Roast eggplant until soft. Peel and mash. Sauté garlic, onion, and green chilli. Mix mashed eggplant, season well, and cook for a few more minutes. Serve hot with roti.

Name: Mixed Vegetable Pakora
recipe: Slice vegetables and mix with flour and spices to make a thick batter. Deep fry spoonfuls until golden brown. Serve hot with chutney.
